intro: Rondeletia inconstans, commonly known as the variable rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture.
